title-group.article-title: Asymptotic Expansions of Gauss-Legendre Quadrature Rules for Integrals with Endpoint Singularities

abstract.p: Let $I[f] = \int\limits_{ - 1}^1 {f(x)dx} $ , where $f \in c^\infty ( - 1,\,1)$ , and let $G_n [f] = \sum\limits_{i = 1}^n {w_{ni} } f(x_{ni} )$ be the n-point Gauss-Legendre quadrature approximation to I[f]. In this paper, we derive an asymptotic expansion as $n \to \infty $ for the error $E_n [f] = I[f] - G_n [f]$ when f(x) has general algebraic-logarithmic singularities at one or both endpoints. We assume that f(x) has asymptotic expansions of the forms $f(x) \sim \sum\limits_{s = 0}^\infty {U_s (\log (1 - x))(1 - x)^{\alpha _s } \,as\,x \to 1 - } $ , $f(x) \sim \sum\limits_{s = 0}^\infty {V_s (\log (1 + x))(1 + x)^{\beta _s } \,as\,x \to - 1 + } $ , where $U_s (y)$ and $V_s (y)$ are some polynomials in y. Here, $\alpha _s $ and $\beta _s $ are, in general, complex and $R\alpha _s ,R\beta _s > - 1$ . An important special case is that in which $U_s (y)$ and $V_s (y)$ are constant polynomials; for this case, the asymptotic expansion of En[f] assumes the form $En[f] \sim \sum\limits_{\scriptstyle s = 0 \hfill \atop \scriptstyle \alpha _s \notin Z^ + \hfill} ^\infty {\sum\limits_{i = 1}^\infty {a_{si} h^{\alpha s + i} } + \sum\limits_{\scriptstyle s = 0 \hfill \atop \scriptstyle \beta _s \notin Z^ + \hfill} ^\infty {\sum\limits_{i = 1}^\infty {b_{si} h^{\beta s + i} } } \,} as\,n \to \infty $ , where $h = (n + 1/2)^{ - 2} ,\,Z^ + = \{ 0,\,1,\,2,\,....\} $ , and $a_{si} $ and $b_{si} $ are constants independent of n.
